content.html:
I’m always talking about how much I love the Indieweb and how there’s no need for a Discovery Algorithm, because people can find stuff by recommendation from others.

While you can generally see the stuff I follow and recommend on my notes page, it seems like a good idea to collect things that I like in an easy-to-find central place!

Blog aggregators

  • Blogroll: A great site for browsing blogs in general, based primarily on interests
  • IndieWeb News: A user-submitted syndication feed of IndieWeb-related content
  • indieweb.xyz: A user-curated directory of content

Tech/science

  • Ars Technica: Basically everything nerdy you can think of
  • MacRumors: Not just about Apple stuff but there’s definitely a focus
  • Hackaday: Hardware projects and inspiration thereof
  • Skepchick

Mental health resources

  • Ask a Manager: Navigating workplaces and careers
  • Captain Awkward: Navigating interpersonal relationships and family issues
  • ADHD Alien

Personal blogs

  • Ben Werdmuller: Has some pretty good opinions about social justice, especially around technology
  • L.M. Orchard
  • cleverdevil
  • eevee (although she’s mostly on cohost these days)
  • jwz
  • A Predator of Information
  • Capital Sidewalks
  • Maffsie
  • Joseph Nebus' serious-ish and humor-ish
  • Captain James
  • Jamie Tanna

Food/cooking

  • Minimalist Baker
  • Food Wishes
  • Eater Seattle (and of course Eater probably has something for whever you are)

Comics

  • Comics RSS: Provides public RSS feeds for a bunch of comic sites that don’t provide their own feeds
  • Comic Rocket: Provides “archive binge” RSS feeds for catching up on long-running comics at a reasonable pace
  • Questionable Content
  • Savage Chickens
  • Walking to Do
  • Trek Comic
  • Real Life Comics
  • Rooster Tails
  • Seasonal Depression
  • Gastrophobia/Pepsiaphobia
  • Val and Isaac
  • Out-of-Placers
  • Oglaf
  • Basic Instructions
  • Modest Medusa
  • Egypt Urnash
  • Buttersafe
  • Ava’s Demon
  • Cigarro & Cerveja
  • Ghost Kiss
  • Holiday Doodles

Local community

  • Capitol Hill Seattle
  • White Center Now
  • GeekGirlCon
  • Double Jump!
  • Seattle Transit Blog
  • Washington Smoke Blog

Arts and Artists

  • Colossal
  • Song Fight!
  • Giftfox
  • Kiriska

Podcasts

  • Ship Full of Jerks
  • The ADHD Manual
  • Nothing Much Happens
  • Get Sleepy
  • Song Exploder

I’m always talking about how much I love the Indieweb and how there’s no need for a Discovery Algorithm, because people can find stuff by recommendation from others.
While you can generally see the stuff I follow and recommend on my notes page, it seems like a good idea to collect things that I like in an easy-to-find central place! name: fluffy
note: A Seattle-based programmer/musician who makes games, comics, and bad decisions.
